headline: Baked Parmesan-Crusted Chicken
description: These baked Parmesan-crusted chicken breasts with bread crumbs, garlic, and herbs are easy to prep for a family-pleasing meal on busy weeknights.

video.description: See how to make a simple breaded and baked chicken recipe.
video.name: Baked Parmesan Crusted Chicken

name: Baked Parmesan-Crusted Chicken
recipeIngredient: 6 (4 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat butter and garlic in a saucepan over medium heat until butter starts to bubble; remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly.

Mix bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, thyme, basil, oregano, pepper, and salt together in a bowl. Dip chicken breasts into melted butter mixture, then press into seasoned bread crumbs. Arrange breaded chicken breasts in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 45 to 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite ways to fix and eat chicken! I used dried herbs instead of fresh (1 T fresh = 1 tsp dried) and Italian breadcrumbs instead of regular (I prefer panko but didn’t have it). Infusing garlic into the butter gave the chicken another layer of flavor. So delicious and really tender.

Nice, crunchy texture to the outside of the chicken; moist on the inside. I decreased the Italian spices a bit and was glad I did. I also poured the leftover butter/garlic sauce into the pan before baking. Served with long grain and wild rice, steamed asparagus, and sourdough bread. A bit hit with the teenagers and my husband!
Love it. Great dinner. Thank you. Too bad no leftovers for salad. Will make again for a salad. Love❤
It was AWESOME!!!!
Great taste and crunchy texture

I’ve made a very similar recipe only instead of using melted butter, using a basting brush, coat the chicken with mayonnaise. If you are carb counting replace the bread crumbs with crushed pork rinds. Trust me, it sounds disgusting, but wow, these are fabulous as a coating.
Everyone loved it! Very flavorful, great texture! My daughter went back for seconds! Made it exactly as the recipe was written.
Great recipe. We used panko crumbs because we didn't have any regular bread crumbs, came out excellent. Definitely a keeper!

Too much oregano, thyme,& basil...
Might try again, but cut those by half.
Also needs to cook on a grated or broiler sheet to get a crispy'r texture.
Tweaked the spices to my family and it was amazing
We liked it very much. The last half of baking I added capers and green onions and the remaining butter.
Very tasty dish.
Super recipe! Family loved it! Adding it to my faves for a company dinner Because it presents so well.

Really good and simple! I didn't have the fresh herbs, so I used dried. I did what another reviewer suggested and doubled the parmesan. I ended up having way more bread crumbs and parm mixture than I needed. I will definitely make this again.

Delicious! So moist and flavorful. I made it (slightly) more heart healthy but using 1/4 c butter and 1/2 c olive oil. Like others I increased the cheese and used dried herbs, about 1/2 tsp each. I flattened the breasts some, for more even cooking, and it only took about 35 mins to get to internal temp of 165.I might increase the oven temp next time to make it a bit more crispy .
Easy and delish! The whole house smelled like garlic, which for us is a good thing :) I used panko crumbs since we had them in the pantry.
I used a can of crushed hidden valley Parmesan salad crispins and crushed them with a ziplock bag and a rolling pin instead of bread crumbs.

Delicious! The only changes I made were to add rosemary and used 1/2 cup of Parm instead of 1/3. Also used another reviewer’s idea to pour the remaining garlic butter around the breasts in the pan. Came out very juicy and flavorful. Family loved it.
My family loves this recipe. I always have to add extra butter and garlic due to our large family and multiple pans to spread the excess.

I used chicken thighs, Italian seasoning mix instead of fresh herbs, Mrs Dash Garlic seasoning with the butter and garlic, seasoned panko with a little seasoned bread crumbs mixed with it. I read the reviews while it was cooking and seen the suggestion to cook it on a rack so that both sides are crispy so half way through I turned and put it on a rack. Definitely a good idea. Didn't really taste the cheese, would probably add some mozzarella next time. Will make again.
It was easy and flavorful. I used the leftovers in a Caesar Salad.
So good can’t wait to make it again
Great, easy recipe! Only change I made was to use chicken thighs instead of breasts.

The flavor was great and the chicken stayed nice and moist. Used dried seasonings as well so followed other's instructions and used 1 teaspoonful of each. Next time I will use less butter or perhaps olive oil as mentioned as well. I felt it was a bit greasy.

I am 21, and this is the first meal I've made at home. Really easy to make - just follow instructions and voila - you have a moist, parmesan-crusted masterpiece. I read the reviews criticizing the amount of spices used - and I actually used the dry (more dense) version of the spices and it turned out perfect. Highly recommend. Will be making again soon!
Made it with no changes and my family loved it! I will definitely be making this again!
Tasted great and very moist. I will be making this again for sure.

This tasted great and was EASY! I will try as others suggested next time and refrigerate the tenders after coating with bread crumbs and butter to see if this gets them crispier. I would eat them again as they are - yum!
Unbelievably moist and delicious!
Very tasty and easy.

A hit with the whole family! I cut 2 large breast halves into the 6 4-ounce pieces and butterflied them slightly so they would cook evenly and faster. You may want to reduce the salt in the breadcrumb mix, as the Parmesan contributes a good deal of saltiness.

Very good and SUPER easy. I put the rest of the butter in the pan and it ended up being too much.
I covered it with foil and when it was done I broiled it for a couple of minutes to let it get a little extra crispy and it was perfect! I love easy recipes :)
We loved it and will definately make it again. No changes were necessary.
I used an Italian seasoning instead of Oregano. It was delicious!
Yumm
I've made it over 6 times. It's my husband's favorite.

I used dried herbs. So I cut the amount of herbs in half. 
Like a lot of reviewers, I added the rest of the garlic butter to the baking dish. 
A big hit. Hubby and my picky teenage daughter both asked for this to get into the meal rotation.

I used dried herbs. So I cut the amount of herbs in half. 
Like a lot of reviewers, I added the rest of the garlic butter to the baking dish. 
A big hit. Hubby and my picky teenage daughter both asked for this to get into the meal rotation.

This chicken is delicious! I used converted amounts of dried spices instead of fresh, and baked the giant "chicken breasts on steroids" from Sam's Club at 450 (yes, that's a 4) for about 45 minutes to internal temp of 165. Will definitely be making again. I think I'll try spraying the chix with butter flavored cooking spray and adding garlic powder to the breadcrumb mixture and see how that turns out.
It was really easy to make and turned out yummy!!!

This dish is DELICIOUS. My husband usually only eats one chicken breast win I fix baked chicken. He ate 2. And the chicken is so moist, it almost melts in your mouth. Great chicken dish if you are having people over for dinner

This has turned into a favorite. The first time I made it, I followed the original recipe and my picky daughter loved it. Since then, I have increased both the parmesan and the garlic to meet our preferred taste. I have also used cornflakes crumbs to make it gluten free for my mother in law, and have always gotten good reviews
Prepared it as it is in the recipe. Was pretty decent.

These were very good! I did use garlic powder in the melted butter and seasoned panko bread crumbs. Very flavorful and actually crispy. I'll definitely make these again. I used bone-in skinless thighs and baked at 375 for about 50 minutes.
Delicious, i added rosemary and used panko instead of breadcrumbs.
Delicious. Used dried basil. didn't have fresh spices. cooked about 50 minutes.
This recipe was excellent, thank you!
Great recipe. Next time I'll add the leftover garlic butter to baking dish. I served with fettuccine Alfredo. Awesome meal.
It was good, I think next time I may only use the oregano seasoning. I did not care for the thyme and basil. It seemed over seasoned for out taste buds.
I love the way this came out. I actually used this to make chicken parmesan. Family loved it.

The outside was crispy. The chicken was juicy. Great flavour. It was so easy. This recipe is a winner.
I swapped out the herbs for a couple of teaspoons of steak spice - delish!
Easy and delicious! Really good with a side of green bean casserole.
Easy to make and delicious with rice and steamed broccoli and cauliflower.
This was delicious. I used olive oil instead of butter and my youngest son (aka pickiest eater EVER) loved it. Great recipe & great for leftovers too!

Very tasty easy dish. Cut large breasts into strips before rolling in butter and crumb mixture. Pressed extra crumbs onto strips. Great leftovers! Baked on aluminum foil sprayed with vegetable spray for easy cleanup. Just baked a second time on parchment paper. Easy clean up! Delicious!
So delicious! Especially with pasta! Although I adjust some of the seasonings since I didn't have everything on hand.

Was almost inedible because I only tasted the thyme, basil, and oregano- I'd half these ingredients. Also needs more butter and little garlic in the pan to not be so dry- But I would definitely try to do this recipe again.
This is super easy and very popular at my house either as a snack or a main course with veggies!
Will definitely make again.
Found my chicken somewhat tasteless
My boys each ate 3 helpings...we'll be making this one again:))
Yum!! Used corned her

I made this chicken for dinner exactly as shown in the recipe except that I had thinly sliced chicken cutlets instead of boneless half breasts. I reduced the cooking time to 17 minutes and I sprinkled the chicken with a little paprika before cooking. It adds some color. There were zero leftovers. Highly successful at our house.
Do not cook this as long as suggested. I did and it was over cooked, dry and tasteless
LOVED this recipe! The only thing I changed is adding a 2nd dipping into the butter and parmesan mixtures. Very unhealthy by so good. I served over spaghetti with fresh raw veggies.
Very easy to make, moist and good results.

This turned out great for me, and I am cooking challenged. I changed the Tbs of fresh herbs to tsps of dried, and used 1/2c butter which was more than enough. Really buttery and crunchy. My husband was impressed! Ha. We both loved it. Would be great with fresh grated parm, next time.

I made this for my 5 and 7 year old sons, and they loved it. I cut up the chicken prior to coating the pieces into large chunks. After I sautéed the garlic and butter together, I just tossed all the chicken into the pan and stirred around. Then I tossed them into a bowl of the bread crumb mixture. Will make again!
Breaded chicken is my Achilles heel in the kitchen, but this recipe makes it nearly fool-proof!
I've made this many times. very good and easy
Chicken was moist but only cooked it about 35 minutes. Too much butter and I didn't love all the spices. Easy enough recipe and will definately tweak it if I make it again.
Made this tonite, delicious! Forgot to take a picture as my family couldn't wait to dig in!

Made this a couple times in the last month. The first time I halved the recipe because I just had two large chicken breasts and didn't want to make the trip to get more. It doesn't half the best. It was tasty but the flavours seemed too strong. I still really enjoyed it so I knew I'd have to try it a second time following the recipe properly, and of course that time turned out much better. I think it doesn't need quite as much better as is called for, and I'd be inclined to throw in a little extra cheese into the coating, but it was a very tasty meal, and made great leftovers as well.
I've made this. Like all recipes I tweak-alter my recipes. I put a cup of parmesan because I want to taste it. And wow, it was amazing!
This is a great easy recipe. Since we had our first kid I've done most of the cooking and with the 2nd on the way, this makes the rotation at least once a week

I made this recipe for the second time tonight. It is fabulous! The best, most moist, most delicious chicken ever. The cook time is pretty accurate, but I did need more of the butter and bread crumb mix to prep the chicken. I also used fresh grated parmesan. Bottom line, this recipe will make everyone happy! My husband isn't even a parmesan fan and he loves this recipe, and the kids gobble it up.
Thanks!
Really like this! So easy& delicious. Family favorite.
My husband now has a new favorite chicken recipe! The breading came out perfectly; flavorable and crunchy. Yes, we will make this again..and again!
Tasted good and was very easy to put together. Mine did not take as long to get done as the recipe stated.
when there is fifteen minutes left I put some marinara sauce on it. with five minutes left I sprinkle mozzarella cheese and a little more marinara. It comes out super juicy and tastes amazing

Easy and tasty. I used a wire cooling rack over a cookie sheet to bake the chicken: it makes it crispier all over. I used dried seasonings, not fresh, no thyme; I also used half butter and half olive oil - still delicious. Leftovers were good cold the next day.
Everyone loved it. I used Italian bread crumbs and skipped the seasonings.
I would cut down a bit on the butter next time. I also poured the remaining over the chicken before baking. My grandkids really liked it and asked for more including the two year old.
The whole family liked it. I poured the extra butter in the baking dish. Chicken was super moist.
Simple and delicious. A "Mom's menu" crowd pleaser that will make super versatile leftovers. Definitely going to be on my go-to for when I just want to throw it together.
So yummy! I used ground spices and halved the amount and it was still good.

I was multi-tasking other chores when I made this dish, I made a couple blunders by not following the recipe exactly, but my husband said it was the best chicken I ever made! I patted my chicken dry and salt and pepper them, added lemon and white wine to the butter garlic mixture, then added the breadcrumbs and parmesan to the butter mixture. OOPS! Rather than throwing it away and starting over I spread mayo on the breasts then pressed the butter- breadcrumb mixture to adhere. Baked them for 1 hour. Came out fantastic!

This was so delicious and smelled so good cooking, my cats sat by the stove! I made my own breadcrumbs and used dry Italian seasoning because that's all I had on hand. Also used breast tenderloins to cook faster and soaked them in the butter and garlic while I was making the crumbs. Will definitely make this again and again.

Really Tasty recipe. I did add a little extra Parmesan to the mix, as a personal preference. Instead of using a baking dish I melted the butter with garlic in my favorite cast iron skillet. After coating the chicken I placed in back in the skillet and put in right in the oven. Gave it a little extra crunch. Also, for the last minute I melted some mozzarella and put it under the broiler to melt down. Served with marinara and angel hair pasta and a caesar salad.

I made it exactly like the directions said. It was good. The edges and the bottom that got crispy were the best. After reading reviews, I think I will put the left over butter and garlic in the bottom of the pan before baking next time.

Made this as a way to jazz up baked chicken on a week night. Very simple. I used all dry herbs as it was a last minute bake and the taste was still good. I'm sure it's even better with herbs. Very moist!
Easy to make, fantastic garlic flavor, and the chicken turned out very moist. Highly recommend trying this recipe.
Made it it was delicious the last 20 minutes of cooking time I put it on broil and it really came out great
Made it exactly as specified and it came out incredibly delicious. I will make again!
Amazing! Added the extra butter/garlic to the pan
The chicken came out delicious!!
Came out amazing!!!!
i would not make ant changes at all. the recipe is very good. i will definitely be making it again.
Cooked at 400 for only 40 min. Used half as much butter with chicken cutlet.
